title: [PINOT-6696] Remove http connection pool in table-size api path
body:
It appears that MultiThreadedHttpConnectionManager is buggy - especially when it encounters a connection refused error on any connection, it fails to "release" the underlying connection and subsequent connections to other servers over the pool encounter connection-refused due to the stale connection. This causes failures in the TableSize API which is invoked during segment upload, failing the upload.

Also, in the current code, we use default size for max connections which is 20; for one of large clusters (with ~80 servers hosting segments of a table), the 20 max connection essentially means that the connections are established and torn down, essentially rendering the pool ineffective. 

If we do need to use a pool, we should consider using PoolingHttpConnectionManager - this requires a httpclient version bump to 4.x.x from the existing 3.1. That is a larger change - for this phase, we'll consider the simpler case of bypassing the pool completely.

Testing done:
Deployed updated binary in integration cluster and hit table/size api on all tables hosted on the controller - checked that the basic functionality worked, there are no resource leaks (via netstat/lsof). Also, checked that there are no connection refused errors to hosts that are up.

title: Adjust code when acquiring rate limit in pinot-broker
body:
This PR adjusts code in acquiring rate limit part, so that when table type is specified, only the rate limiter for that subtype would be called. 
Use case 1:
tableName: testTable
Both rate limiters( if applicable) will be called.

Use case 2:
tableName: testTable_OFFLINE
Only offline rate limiter ( if applicable) will be called.

Use case 3:
tableName: testTable_REALTIME
Only real-time rate limiter ( if applicable) will be called.

Use case 4:
tableName: testTable_WrongTableType
It'll be handled before `TableQueryQuotaManager` gets called.

In addition, swap the logic between metric emittion and quota check in `tryAcquireToken` method, so that Metric `QueryQuotaCapacityUtilization` would also be emitted even if quota check returns false.

title: Reducing garbage when indexing multi-value columns
body:
The dictionary ID of multi-valued columns need to be in sorted order for any given docId in the fwd index.
In the dictionary creator, when adding the multi-value field, we already create a new array. It makes
sense to sort the values right there, and assume that the values coming into the fwd index builder
are always sorted. This way, we avoid creating another array for multi-valued columns during
segment creation.

Verified that there are no other callers to te fwd index builder, and also updated javadoc to reflect
the new expectation of the input.

title: Add inverted index option for offline data gen
body: * Currently, if the client's table config sets inverted index columns, there is no way to disable inverted index generation during segment generation. If we add this ability, we can configure this in our table config. Because generating an inverted index can lead to inflated segment sizes, this parameter will be useful if the user has trouble pushing their segment because of its size/if push takes too long and the user would rather take the hit to generate on the server side.

title: Verify table type when deleting table
body:
Since the param `tableName` may contain table type as suffix, this PR adds logic to check whether this case exists. 
++++++++
Use case 1:
tableName: TestTable, tableTypeStr: null
Both `deleteOfflineTable` and `deleteRealtimeTable ` will be called.

Use case 2:
tableName: TestTable_OFFLINE, tableTypeStr: null
Only `deleteOfflineTable` will be called.

Use case 3:
tableName: TestTable_OFFLINE, tableTypeStr: OFFLINE
Only `deleteOfflineTable` will be called.

Use case 4:
tableName: TestTable_OFFLINE, tableTypeStr: REALTIME
Throws 400 exception.

Use case 5:
tableName: TestTable, tableTypeStr: OFFLINE
Only `deleteOfflineTable` will be called.

title: [PINOT-6738] Deprioritize multivalue columns when evaluating filter expressions
body:
Phase 1 changes.
Changes include:
- Exposing datasource metadata and predicate evaluator through BaseFilterOperator. PredicateEvaluator is not currently used. Will be used in future revisions.
- Updating FilterOperatorUtils to return priority for scanning based single-value/multivalue columns. Single value cols have lower priority. 
- The optimization can be disabled per query using "useMVOpt" flag.

Testing done:
Ran a production query which has many multivalue columns in filter expression. Without the change, the latency is about 580ms on average, with the change we see it reduce to ~250ms

title: [PINOT-6736] Fix min size for hash-set in In/NotIn predicate impl
body: In/NotIn predicate implementations typically use small hash sets. Profiling shows non-trivial amount of time spent in hash-set contains() calls. Testing showed that fixing a min hash set size improves the performance at little extra memory overhead. for one of the queries we see in production which averages about 580ms, this change reduced the latency down to 430ms.

title: Make DistinctCountHLL, PercentileEst and PercentileTDigest work on both value and serialized bytes
body:
Pre-requisite for star-tree
Whether the value is original value or serialized bytes from star-tree should be transparent to users:
- For the same aggregation (DistinctCountHLL, PercentileEst or PercentileTDigest), we should return the same result regardless of whether there is star-tree
- User should have no knowledge about whether the segment has star-tree index or not, the only observation should be the query latency drops drastically
- User should not use special type of aggregation function (such as FastHLL over DistinctCountHLL) to explicitly choose to use star-tree

Also add PercentileTDigestMV aggregation function to work on multi-valued numeric columns

title: Freeing up the reference to PropertiesConfiguration after loading seg…
body:
…ment metadata

We were holding on to the propertiesConfiguration object after loading the segment metadata which consumed extra memory. Even though the overhead is quite small for each segment, it adds up. In one of the environment with 25k segments, this attributed to 3G. With this change, the memory footprint reduced to ~250mb. This is lot of saving not just in terms of memory usage but also impact on GC since these are long lived and get moved around every time there is a major compaction.

title: Verify hybrid table contains the same table configs in its both subtype tables
body: Previously for a hybrid table, it's allowable to have different metadata in table configs, which makes the time column name and type could be different. This leads to an issue that if one single sub-table is queried, the result will be returned. If a query uses raw table name, which means querying on both sub-tables, the result would be empty. Thus, in order to avoid this, we should validate the table config when we upload/update it for the hybrid table use case.

repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

title: Ignore NettyCloseChannelTest
body:
This test sometimes fails only in Travis because the hardwares who run this test may not have sufficient cores to be assigned to all the threads at a time.   
The reason why this test can be ignored is the purpose of this test is to test the response is null when the server connection gets closed. Whereas because of the hardware in Travis, threads in worker group may still get the request and thus cannot be closed in time. The expected behavior is that response is null but it's still acceptable when this response isn't null, i.e. getting a real response. And users won't have any big effect when getting a non-null response. What's more, discussed with Jackie offline, this part of code will be rewritten in the near future. So for now it's ok to just ignore this test.

title: Remove leadership check when setting up metadata for new table
body: Adding a new table can be done by any controller, not just the leader. We should not check for leadership when adding metadata in this case, else we will end up not creating metadata but updating the ideal state. This results in an incorrect setup for an hour until the validation anager fixes it

title: Re-implement PinotDataBuffer to make it thread-safe and support large buffer and native order
body:
1. Support trackable large buffer (>2G)
2. Support both BIG-ENDIAN and LITTLE-ENDIAN buffer
3. Thread-safe
4. All buffer read/write are offset based, no need to maintain the buffer position
5. Change OffHeapBitmapInvertedIndexCreator to use PinotDataBuffer so the large buffer becomes trackable

TODO: will change OffHeapStarTreeBuilder to use PinotDataBuffer in a separate PR

repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

title: [PINOT-6677] Clean up any existing segment dir before replacing a segment
body:
In LLC, it is possible that a server tries to commit a segment, the commit fails, and eventually
another server commits the same segment with a different end offset. In that case, the
server that originally tried to commit the segment will get a DISCARD on for the consumer,
and eventually a state transition to ONLINE. In that case, we should clean out the original
segment before replacing it.

title: Fix NPE when rebalance is called with a table that does not exist

Currently a typo in the tablename when we invoke rebalance results in NPE.
 curl -X POST 'localhost:11984/tables/non-existent/rebalance?dryrun=false&type=offline'
{"code":500,"error":null}

This PR fixes it and adds tests for the same.

title: Reduce the number of threads used in test
body:
Previously this test often failed at the following exception:
```
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to shutdown the worker group in 60000 ms
	at com.linkedin.pinot.transport.netty.NettyCloseChannelTest.testCloseServerChannel(NettyCloseChannelTest.java:96)
```
Looking into the code, worker group is assigned 20 threads when the constructor gets called. While in Travis, the machine could be lack of available threads.

repo.name: pinot
repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

title: Adjust info message to differentiate use case
body:
The log message would be like the following:
Successful case:
```
StorageQuotaChecker - Refreshing segment testSegment1 of Table testTable is within quota. Total allowed storage size: 5.86KB ( = configured quota: 2.93KB * number replicas: 2). New estimated table size of all replicas: 5.81KB. Current table size of all replicas: 4.69KB. Incoming uncompressed segment size of all replicas: 2KB ( = single incoming uncompressed segment size: 1KB * number replicas: 2). Existing same segment size of all replicas: 900B. Formula: New estimated size = current table size - existing same segment size + incoming segment size
```
Failed case:
```
StorageQuotaChecker - Storage quota exceeded. Newly estimated size: 5.81KB ( = existing estimated uncompressed size of all replicas: 4.69KB - (existing segment sizes of all replicas: 900B) + (incoming compressed segment size: 1KB * number replicas: 2)) > total allowed storage size: 5.47KB ( = configured quota: 2.73KB * number replicas: 2) for table testTable.
StorageQuotaChecker - Table testTable already over quota. Existing estimated uncompressed table size of all replicas: 5.86KB > total allowed storage size: 5.47KB ( = configured quota: 2.73KB * num replicas: 2). Check if indexes were enabled recently and adjust table quota accordingly.
```
